episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" was recorded live at the Theatre Royal Drury Lane and featured facts about the theatre's history, the Slovenian president's past job, unusual age demographics in Tower Hamlets, and a club celebrating failure. The hosts discussed topics ranging from theatre fires and Masonic rituals to trademark disputes and the peculiarities of aging statistics.

facts.fact: The very theater we're recording this show in, the Theater Royal Drury Lane, was known in 1794 as the Fireproof Theater.
The president of Slovenia's previous job was to stop people naming cakes after Melania Trump.
Tower Hamlets in London has by far the most 105-year-olds in the country, and by far the fewest 90-year-olds.
In 1979, the not terribly good club of Great Britain, which celebrated failure, had to depose its president for being too successful at the job.
